{{quote|
WHAT IS JAPPA DOING TO MY MINECRAFT?

Changing the textures! Except for a few, like the Creeper.

Across all versions? YEP, both on Java and Bedrock. You cannot escape my sweet, sweet textures.<br>
When? Soon! In the Beta Resource Pack, where all my beloved pixels live.|Jasper "JAPPA" Boerstra<ref name=quote>{{citation|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181210033947/https://twitter.com/JasperBoerstra/status/928968321277530113|title=WHAT IS JAPPA DOING TO MY MINECRAFT?}} â€“ [https://twitter.com/JasperBoerstra @JasperBoerstra], November 10, 2017</ref>||Jasper Boerstra Mojang avatar.png}}

The '''Texture Update''' is an update released as part of [[Java Edition 1.14]],<ref>{{snap|18w43a|October 24, 2018}}</ref> [[Bedrock Edition 1.10.0]],<ref>{{citation|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190710033837/https://twitter.com/mattgartzke/status/1090700501056839685|title=The first 1.10 beta is here with shields and new textures!}} -[https://twitter.com/mattgartzke @Mattgartzke], January 30, 2019</ref> and [[PlayStation 4 Edition 1.90]] (as well as minor revisions in subsequent updates for textures that were left behind).
The update changes almost every texture in the game,<ref>{{Mcnet|try-new-minecraft-java-textures|Try the new Minecraft Java Textures|January 31, 2018|Tom Stone}}</ref> except for a few iconic textures such as the [[creeper]]. The textures were developed primarily by [[JAPPA]] (Jasper Boerstra). The original textures (with the exception of [[leather horse armor]]) are available as a resource pack/texture pack, which is in the game by default {{in|java}}, and has a separate download {{in|bedrock}} (named "'''Programmer Art'''" {{in|java}}, and "'''Minecraft Classic Texture Pack'''" {{in|bedrock}}).<ref>{{snap|18w44a|October 31, 2018}}</ref><ref>[https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/marketplace/pdp/minecraft/minecraft-classic-texture-pack/58d525a7-f93d-41a6-b1f3-c7887e2dad3d Minecraft Classic Texture Pack]</ref>

== Textures not updated ==
While the vast majority of textures were updated since [[Java Edition 1.14]], the following textures remained unchanged since [[Java Edition 1.13]].

=== Blocks ===
* Attached Pumpkin Stem, not the normal version however
* Melon Stem, not the attached version however
* All Shulker Box particles (block folder)
* Dirt, Coarse Dirt
* Podzol side
* Daylight Detector
* Debug textures (debug, debug2)
* Block breaking stages (destroy_stage_0 to 9)
* Dragon Egg
* Fire (fire_0, fire_1)
* Grass Block (side & top textures; overlay was changed)
* Lava Flow, Lava Still
* Nether Portal
* Redstone Dust (dot, line0, line1, overlay)
* Sea Lantern
* Structure Blocks
* Tripwire

=== Miscellaneous ===
* Although [[chest]]s, [[trapped chest]]s and Christmas chests had their png files changed (file sizes too), they still use their old textures/pixels rather than updated ones.
* The offline default [[Skin|player skins]], "Steve" and "Alex", had not been updated originally, creating a mismatch between the "Steve" texture and the [[zombie]] texture, which are supposed to be related.
** This is no longer the case as of [[Java Edition 1.19.3]], which introduced the updated "Steve" and "Alex" skin texture as well as seven more default skins.
* The bottom texture of the [[Enchanting Table]] is now visually similar to [[Obsidian]] (albeit the file size being different).
** [[Enchanting Table]] used to have borders on all sides (to differentiate from Obsidian) before it was changed in this texture update.
* [[Sugar cane]] did not have its block texture changed.
** As of [[Java Edition 1.17|1.17]], the item texture itself was changed to be more accurate to the block's default tinted color.

=== Inconsistencies ===
* The border of the [[Cactus]] bottom texture still uses the color scheme of the old cactus side texture, as opposed to the current side texture.<ref>{{bug|MC-150572}}</ref>

==== Textures using old elements ====
* The top texture of the [[observer]] is still largely based on the old "polished cobblestone" texture, rather than its updated version.<ref>{{bug|MC-199231|||WAI}}</ref>
* The top texture of the [[ender chest]] is still largely based on the old "cobblestone" texture, rather than its updated version.<ref>{{bug|MC-202573|||WF}}</ref>
* The [[bedrock]] texture in natural [[End crystal]]s has not been updated at all.<ref>{{bug|MC-160720}}</ref>
* Spectator icons, such as the 'exit menu' and 'teleport to player' are still based on the old [[barrier]]<ref>{{bug|MC-152331}}</ref> and [[eye of ender]] textures.<ref>{{bug|MC-191033}}</ref>
* The pack.png for the default resource pack still uses the old [[grass block]] and [[cobblestone]] textures, rather than their updated version.<ref>{{bug|MC-178216}}</ref>
* Dyed versions of [[terracotta]] have not been updated, although their undyed version has.<ref>{{bug|MC-161716}}</ref>

==== Slots and outlines ====
* The empty armor slot textures in the [[Inventory]] still use the old textures, rather than their updated versions.<ref>{{bug|MC-173455}}</ref>
* The icons on [[Statistics]] still use old item textures, rather than their updated versions.

=== Unsorted ===
* Despite being visually similar before the update, the leather tunic overlay lost its transparent textures, where it once had an unused texture.
* The hand texture of the [[Drowned]] uses an old [[Zombie]] hand texture rather than the new one.<ref>{{bug|MC-162748|||WAI}}</ref> This also affects [[Zombie Villager]]s, [[Illager]]s and [[Vex]]es.<ref>{{bug|MC-169466|||WAI}}</ref>
** [[Vex]] texture and model was updated on [[Java Edition 1.19.3]].
* [[Podzol]] still uses its old side texture rather than an updated one, even though its top texture is updated.<ref>{{bug|MC-204899}}</ref>
* While normal [[pumpkin stem]] and attached [[melon stem]] use updated textures, attached pumpkin stem and normal melon stem still use the old ones.<ref>{{bug|MC-203483|||WAI}}</ref>
* [[Grass Block]]s still use their old top texture rather than an updated one that has appeared in Texture Update Betapacks V1 & V2.

== Trivia ==
* While the Creeper texture was not changed, its file size was.
* On April 1, 2018, the Texture Update was "released" on {{el|je}} as an April Fools' joke. DOS-styled 8-bit default version of textures, with heavy reductions in detail, were released for Java Edition, available in versions of [[Java Edition 1.12|1.12.x]] and 1.13 snapshots from [[17w43a]] to [[18w11a]], with the thread claiming that all editions of ''Minecraft'' would eventually get the textures.<ref>{{Mcnet|java-edition-textures-finally-perfected|Java Edition Textures Finally Perfected|April 1, 2018}}</ref>
** The textures were reverted to the way they were before on April 2, 2018.<ref>{{tweet|dinner|980718994956210176|April fools! The new Minecraft textures have a few more colours than this ;)|April 2, 2018}}</ref> These textures cannot be re-activated by setting the device's date to April 1, 2018 as it is a server-side update.
**These textures only replaced the default textures, so using a Resource Pack would hide the textures the resource pack would change.
* The Texture Update Beta Pack gallery on the [[Minecraft Marketplace]] in Bedrock Edition uses screenshots from Java Edition.
* In a now deleted Tweet, [[JAPPA]] announced on November 10, 2017 that the new textures would be available on "all versions" of Minecraft. However, the update was only released on editions that were supported at the time of release, specifically [[Java Edition]], [[Bedrock Edition]], and [[PlayStation 4 Edition]].<ref name=quote>{{citation|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20181210033947/https://twitter.com/JasperBoerstra/status/928968321277530113|title=WHAT IS JAPPA DOING TO MY MINECRAFT?}} â€“ [https://twitter.com/JasperBoerstra @JasperBoerstra], November 10, 2017</ref>
* The "polished cobblestone" on the piston prior to the texture update used to match the furnace top texture. After the texture update, they no longer share the same design.
* On [[PlayStation 4 Edition]], the [[Block of Emerald]] texture was updated along with the other textures, but it did not receive the changes to it from [[Java Edition 19w08a|19w08a]]/[[Bedrock Edition beta 1.11.0.5|beta 1.11.0.5]].
